task_name: Research AI Video Tools to Complete Missing Tool Documentation
context: to complete missing documentation for 6 tools with discovered_needs_review status
description: Comprehensive research task to complete missing data for 6 AI video tools (Hedra, HeyGen, Synthesia, RunwayML, Vozo AI, Hailo) identified with incomplete taxonomy documentation. Uses YouTube Video Research Prompt methodology aligned with Remote Helpers November 2025 strategic initiatives, focusing on Open-Source Video Generation (WAN 2.2) and video production optimization. Outputs fully documented tool JSON files with all TBD fields populated and integration workflows identified.
dependencies: Access to YouTube, Perplexity AI, and Google Search
Permission to update tool JSON files
success_criteria: All 26 missing data fields across 6 tools populated with specific data
All TBD values replaced with accurate information
All empty arrays filled with minimum required items
8-12 relevant YouTube videos identified and scored (Remote Helpers Relevance Score)
Top 3-5 videos watched and insights extracted
Comparison matrix created for video tools (Hedra vs HeyGen vs Synthesia vs RunwayML)
Integration workflows documented with Remote Helpers tech stack
Subscription renewal recommendations provided for expired accounts (Vozo AI, Hailo)
All 6 tool JSON files updated and validated

troubleshooting.issue: Cannot find enough recent videos (30-60 days)
troubleshooting.solution: Expand date range to 90 days, or search for tool name + '2025' for latest content
Focus on preferred creators (Matthew Berman, Matt Wolfe) who balance depth with accessibility
Check official documentation, contact sales for quote, or note 'Contact for pricing' in cost_structure

troubleshooting.issue: Tool capabilities unclear from videos alone
troubleshooting.solution: Supplement with official documentation, product demos, or free tier hands-on testing
Prioritize official documentation > recent videos > older sources; note date of information

optimization_tips: Use Perplexity AI for initial search - faster than manual YouTube searching
Watch videos at 1.5x or 2x speed for time efficiency
Take timestamped notes during video watching for easy reference
Use YouTube auto-generated transcripts to quickly scan content
Create a shared comparison spreadsheet if working with Video department
Test free tiers of tools when documentation is insufficient
future_enhancements: Automate video discovery using Perplexity API
